document_data.refs3e: Vanrakdoom makes mention of a spell named Trobriands Glassteel, and references it as being part of City of Splendors, but no such spell appears in the book or any of its attendant materials.While 3rd edition books seem to prefer the use of glassteel as a material, as Eric L. Boyd is credited as an author on both Races of Faerun and Champions of Valor, where glassteel as a material is introduced both to 3rd edition and to 3.5, the inclusion of the spell can only be considered deliberate.Upon inquiry, a detail provided by George Krashos on Candlekeep, and confirmed by Eric L. Boyd, author of both Vanrakdoom and City of Splendors, adds the details assumed here.
document_data.mainbody:
Such details can be considered otherwise foregone conclusions, given the fact that the spells effect is to alter properties, traditionally the province of transmutation, and its clear similarities with glassteel (spell) in 1st and 2nd edition.Furthermore, Boyd explicitly states his intent to recreate glassteel, further confirming that the spell is intended to behave similarly to glassteel. Thus, this information is accepted, with this note added to explain at length the caveat that it is unpublished material.
Trobriands glassteel was a spell that hardened materialsThough no mention is made of the spell rendering the substance clearer, chalcedony is translucid at best, not transparent in nature the Vanrakdoom examples are explicitly transparent. It is assumed in this article that the spell modifying the look of chalcedony is more likely than a naturally transparent chalcedony. It was akin to glassteel.
Materials affected by the spell were hardened to the strength of iron or steel, likely also made more transparent.
Per records from sages familiar with the matter, the spell was akin to glassteel and possessed both verbal and somatic components, as well as requiring a small piece of iron as its material component.
The spell was ostensibly developed by Trobriand. It had been used to reinforce several chalcedony statues in Vanrakdoom at some point on or prior to .
